isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL® VT 365 DIESEL ENGINE - FRONT COVER, VIBRATION DAMPER, and GEROTOR OIL PUMP - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Thermostat

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear heat resistant gloves and appropriate eye protection during thermostat operation checks.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage when servicing thermostat, make sure the thermostat opens fully at the specified temperature to avoid overheating.

note.para: Only genuine International® thermostats ensure correct coolant flow and positive sealing for correct engine cooling.

step1.para: Manually open the thermostat enough to insert a nylon ribbon under the valve seat. Suspend the thermostat in a container so the thermostat does not touch the bottom of the container.

Heat the water filled container to the approximate Start-To-Open temperature of the thermostat, (see specifications for temperature). Observe the thermometer and record the temperature as soon as the thermostat drops from the nylon ribbon. This is the Start-To-Open temperature. See specifications for sleeve travel at the start to open temperature
Continue to heat the water to the Full-Open temperature of the thermostat (see Specifications for temperature). Observe the thermometer and movement of the thermostat sleeve.
While sleeve is off its seat, remove thermostat from container and inspect seat area for pitting and foreign deposits.
If the thermostat is damaged or operates incorrectly, replace thermostat.
